# Daily Digest RPL Formulas

> Note: All formulas are calculated at store-product combination level unless otherwise specified as aggregated metrics.

## 1. Price and Cost Calculations

### Average Sales Price (ASP)

```formula
Average Sales Price = Total Sales Revenue ÷ Total Sales Quantity
```

- Calculated over the lookback period (default 28 days)
- Grouped by country and product (or other configurable grouping)

### Effective Price

```formula
Effective Price = Price Product Level if available, otherwise Average Sales Price
```

### Price and Cost Imputation

The system uses a priority order for filling missing price/COGS values:

1. Country-product level lookup (MODE within country for same product_id)
2. Imputation using ASP (calculated at country-product level) and default margin

### Corrected Cost of Goods Sold (COGS)

metadata.title: Comprehensive List of All Formulas in the KPI Summary Generator - Daily Digest Agent - v1

content:
SP (calculated at country-product level) and default margin

### Corrected Cost of Goods Sold (COGS)

```formula
IF COGS Product Level IS NULL OR COGS Product Level <= 0 THEN
    Corrected COGS = Effective Price × (1 - Default Average Margin)
ELSE
    Corrected COGS = COGS Product Level
END IF
```

Default Average Margin: 30% (configurable)

### Corrected Price

```formula
IF Effective Price IS NULL OR Effective Price <= 0 THEN
    Corrected Price = COGS Product Level ÷ (1 - Default Average Margin)
ELSE
    Corrected Price = Effective Price
END IF
```

## 2. Days of Supply Calculations

### Average Sales Rates

#### Average Daily Sales

```formula
IF Total Sales IS NULL OR Total Sales < 0 THEN
    Average Sales = NULL
ELSE
    Average Sales = ROUND(Total Sales ÷ Lookback Days)
END IF
```

> Note: No imputation is performed. NULL values are preserved for data integrity.

#### Average Daily Forecast

metadata.title: Comprehensive List of All Formulas in the KPI Summary Generator - Daily Digest Agent - v1

content:
imputation is performed. NULL values are preserved for data integrity.

#### Average Daily Forecast

```formula
IF Cover Period IS NULL OR Cover Period <= 0 THEN
    Average Forecast = NULL
ELSE
    Average Forecast = ROUND(Cover Period Forecast ÷ Cover Period)
END IF
```

> Note: No imputation is performed. NULL values are preserved for data integrity.

### Days of Supply Metrics (Store-Product Level)

> Note: Days of Supply metrics are calculated at aggregated levels only, not at individual store-product level.

#### Total Planned Inventory

```formula
Total Planned Inventory = Store Inventory On Hand +
                          COALESCE(Store Inventory In Transit, 0) +
                          COALESCE(Store Inventory Open Order, 0) +
                          COALESCE(Store Inventory Purchase Order, 0) +
                          COALESCE(Constrained Quantity, 0)
```

#### Total Inventory

metadata.title: Comprehensive List of All Formulas in the KPI Summary Generator - Daily Digest Agent - v1

content:
se Order, 0) +
                          COALESCE(Constrained Quantity, 0)
```

#### Total Inventory

```formula
Total Inventory = Store Inventory On Hand +
                  COALESCE(Store Inventory In Transit, 0) +
                  COALESCE(Store Inventory Open Order, 0) +
                  COALESCE(Store Inventory Purchase Order, 0)
```

## 3. Inventory Indicators

### Overstock Threshold

```formula
Overstock Threshold = CEIL((GREATEST(Final Target Inventory, Presentation Level) - 1) + Casepack Quantity Max)
```

Uses the maximum of `Final Target Inventory` and `Presentation Level`, then adds `Casepack Quantity Max` and applies ceiling rounding.

### Overstocked Indicator

```formula
IF Total Planned Inventory > Overstock Threshold THEN
    Overstocked Indicator = 1
ELSE
    Overstocked Indicator = 0
END IF
```

### Optimization Constraint

```formula
Optimization Constraint = Constrained Quantity - Unconstrained Quantity
```

metadata.title: Comprehensive List of All Formulas in the KPI Summary Generator - Daily Digest Agent - v1

content:
n Constraint

```formula
Optimization Constraint = Constrained Quantity - Unconstrained Quantity
```

Negative values indicate insufficient inventory at distribution center.

### Casepack Loss

```formula
Casepack Loss = Rounded Need - Need
```

Represents the difference due to casepack rounding requirements.

### Primary Constraint Type

```formula
IF Optimization Constraint < 0 THEN
    Primary Constraint Type = "Optimization Constraint"
ELSE IF Casepack Loss < 0 THEN
    Primary Constraint Type = "Casepack Rounding"
ELSE
    Primary Constraint Type = "Other"
END IF
```

## 4. Risk Metrics

The system supports two calculation modes: Simple Mode and Stochastic Mode. The mode is configurable via `use_stochastic_demand_calculation` parameter.

### 4.1. Common Risk Metric Calculations (Both Modes)

#### Lead Time Forecast

metadata.title: Comprehensive List of All Formulas in the KPI Summary Generator - Daily Digest Agent - v1

content:
culation` parameter.

### 4.1. Common Risk Metric Calculations (Both Modes)

#### Lead Time Forecast

```formula
IF Cover Period > 0 AND Cover Period Forecast IS NOT NULL THEN
    Lead Time Forecast = (Lead Time ÷ Cover Period) × Cover Period Forecast
ELSE
    Lead Time Forecast = NULL
END IF
```

#### Replenishment Window Period

```formula
Replenishment Window Period = Cover Period - Lead Time
```

#### Replenishment Window Forecast

```formula
Replenishment Window Forecast = Cover Period Forecast - Lead Time Forecast
```

#### Expected Demand After Lead Time (Dollar)

```formula
Expected Demand After Lead Time (Dollar) = Replenishment Window Forecast × Corrected Price
```

#### Inventory After Delivery Window and Order

```formula
Inventory After Delivery Window and Order = GREATEST(Total Planned Inventory - Lead Time Forecast, 0)
```

#### Expected Sales After Lead Time

metadata.title: Comprehensive List of All Formulas in the KPI Summary Generator - Daily Digest Agent - v1

content:
= GREATEST(Total Planned Inventory - Lead Time Forecast, 0)
```

#### Expected Sales After Lead Time

```formula
Expected Sales After Lead Time = LEAST(Inventory After Delivery Window and Order, Replenishment Window Forecast)
```

#### Expected Sales After Lead Time (Dollar)

```formula
Expected Sales After Lead Time (Dollar) = Expected Sales After Lead Time × Corrected Price
```

#### Margin Per Unit

```formula
Margin Per Unit = Corrected Price - Corrected COGS
```

#### Overstock Inventory Value

```formula
Overstock Amount = GREATEST(Total Planned Inventory - Overstock Threshold, 0)
Overstock Inventory Value = Overstock Amount × Corrected COGS
```

#### Overstock Units

```formula
Overstock Units = GREATEST(Total Planned Inventory - Overstock Threshold, 0)
```

#### Total Inventory COGS

```formula
Total Inventory COGS = Total Inventory × Corrected COGS
```

#### Unfulfilled Demand Value

metadata.title: Comprehensive List of All Formulas in the KPI Summary Generator - Daily Digest Agent - v1

content:
``formula
Total Inventory COGS = Total Inventory × Corrected COGS
```

#### Unfulfilled Demand Value

```formula
Unfulfilled Demand Value = (Unconstrained Quantity - Constrained Quantity) × Corrected Price
```

#### Allocated Revenue Contribution (Order Dollar Value)

```formula
Allocated Revenue Contribution = COALESCE(Constrained Quantity × Corrected Price, 0)
```

If constrained quantity is missing, treated as zero.

### 4.2. Simple Mode Risk Calculations

When `use_stochastic_demand_calculation = False`, the system uses simple day-based calculations.

#### Is At Stockout Risk

```formula
Expected Stockout Magnitude After Lead Time = GREATEST(Replenishment Window Forecast - Inventory After Delivery Window and Order, 0)

IF Expected Stockout Magnitude After Lead Time > 0 THEN
    Is At Stockout Risk = 1
ELSE
    Is At Stockout Risk = 0
END IF
```

#### Potential Lost Sales

```formula
Potential Lost Sales = Expected Stockout Magnitude After Lead Time
```

metadata.title: Comprehensive List of All Formulas in the KPI Summary Generator - Daily Digest Agent - v1

content:
ential Lost Sales

```formula
Potential Lost Sales = Expected Stockout Magnitude After Lead Time
```

#### Potential Lost Sales Value

```formula
Potential Lost Sales Value = GREATEST(Potential Lost Sales × Corrected Price, 0)
```

#### Potential Lost Margin

```formula
Potential Lost Margin = Potential Lost Sales × GREATEST(Corrected Price - Corrected COGS, 0)
```

#### Stockout Probability (Simple Mode)

Lead Time Stockout Probability:

```formula
IF Lead Time > 0 AND Lead Time Forecast IS NOT NULL AND Total Inventory < Lead Time Forecast THEN
    Lead Time Stockout Probability = 1.0
ELSE
    Lead Time Stockout Probability = 0.0
END IF
```

Replenishment Window Stockout Probability:

```formula
Replenishment Window Stockout Probability = CAST(Is At Stockout Risk AS DOUBLE)
```

> Note: In simple mode, probabilities are binary (0.0 or 1.0) based on the stockout risk flag.

### 4.3. Stochastic Mode Risk Calculations

When `use_stochastic_demand_calculation = True`, the system uses advanced stochastic formulas with Negative Binomial distribution.

#### Is At Stockout Risk

```sql
Replenishment Window Stockout Probability = rw_stockout_probability(
    total_inventory,
    constrained_quantity,
    replenishment_window_forecast,
    lead_time_forecast,
    vmr
)

IF Replenishment Window Stockout Probability > Stockout Risk Threshold (default 0.2) THEN
    Is At Stockout Risk = 1
ELSE
    Is At Stockout Risk = 0
END IF
```

## 6. Growth Analysis

### Growth Rate Calculations

#### Recent Sales

```formula
Recent Sales = SUM(ty__{start}_{end}_sales_quantity)
```

Example: Sum of sales for the last 14 days (`ty__14_0_sales_quantity`)

#### Historical Sales

```formula
Historical Sales = SUM(ly__{start}_{end}_sales_quantity)
```

Example: Sum of sales for the same 14-day period last year (`ly__14_0_sales_quantity`)

#### Growth Rate

```formula
IF Historical Sales > 0 THEN
    Growth Rate = ((Recent Sales - Historical Sales) ÷ Historical Sales) × 100
ELSE
    Growth Rate = 100%
END IF
```

Expressed as a percentage, rounded to 2 decimal places.

#### Absolute Growth

```formula
Absolute Growth = Recent Sales - Historical Sales
```

Rounded to 2 decimal places.

## 8. Health Score Calculation

### Health Score Weights

content:

```

Rounded to 2 decimal places.

## 8. Health Score Calculation

### Health Score Weights

| Metric | Weight | Effect |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Projected Stockout Ratio | -25% | Reduces score |
| Projected Lost Margin Ratio | -20% | Reduces score |
| Overstocked Pair Ratio | -15% | Reduces score |
| Overstock Value Ratio | -10% | Reduces score |
| Fulfillment Rate | +20% | Increases score |

### Health Score Formula

Start with base score of 100 (`MAX_HEALTH_SCORE`)

```formula
Health Score = ROUND(
    100
    + (Projected Stockout Ratio × -0.25)
    + (Projected Lost Margin Ratio × -0.20)
    + (Overstocked Pair Ratio × -0.15)
    + (Overstock Value Ratio × -0.10)
    + (Fulfillment Rate × 0.20)
)

IF Health Score < 0 THEN
    Final Health Score = 0
ELSE IF Health Score > 100 THEN
    Final Health Score = 100
ELSE
    Final Health Score = Health Score
END IF
```

> Final Health Score is always between 0 and 100 (inclusive)

content:
# Step 1: Update Changelog

Increment the version number according to SemVer (semantic versioning) guidence. If it is just a minor fix, use patch versions, and if it is a new feature or improvement, use minor version. Use major for breaking changes or large-scale rollouts.

Create an empty UNDER DEVELOPMENT section.

Do this changes in a branch that matches to release number.

# Step 2: Open your PR:

You should open a new PR, labelled as “release” and tag your team members.

# Step 3: Merge the PR

The PR should be merged to reflect changelog changes and trigger a build on Jenkins.

The following steps should be followed by whoever merges the PR

1. Merge THE PR with “release” label.

1. Go to “Releases” Page in gensight repository

1. Click to Draft a new release

1. Click to “Tag” and Click “Create New Tag”

metadata.title: How to Release Gensight Library and Applications

content:
n gensight repository

1. Click to Draft a new release

1. Click to “Tag” and Click “Create New Tag”

1. Enter the version name. Dont forget to start with “v” and follow semantic versioning conventions. It is essential for the reliability of our build processes. Example: v0.20.0

1. Select the previous release and click “Generate Release Notes”. Then Click to “Publish release”

1. Check if you were fast enough! You should complete the merge + tagging just before Jenkins discovers the changes in main branches. According to schedule of Jenkins (default pulls the changes by polling every 10 minutes), you may have very small amount of time. So if a main branch build starts, it means that your tag has missed the branch. For a successful release, git head should point to the tag. So, cancel the current run and start a new run.

metadata.title: How to Release Gensight Library and Applications

Purpose
This page documents the recent UI/UX improvements on the Daily Action Board, focusing on how KPI changes and trends are calculated, visualized, and interacted with.

Figma Prototype
👉 [Daily Action Board KPI Comparison](https://www.figma.com/proto/yu3k74lGvErQVCHbuk2OT5/Daily-Action-Board?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=1-34737&viewport=393%2C-505%2C0.26&t=jJZAOdjvVdPgomlK-1&scaling=min-zoom&content-scaling=fixed&starting-point-node-id=1%3A34737)

## 1. KPI Cards – Change Indicators

### 1.1 Overall Behavior

KPI cards on the Daily Action Board visually compare Current Value against:

- Last 1 Day, or
- Last 7 Days.

The user can select Last 1 Day or Last 7 Days from a global control on the page. This selection:

- Updates the change indicators on all KPI cards
- Updates all related tooltip content

The behavior is global and synchronized across all KPI cards.

---

### 1.2 Change Indicator Color Logic

metadata.title: Daily Action Board KPI Comparison and Trend Indicators

content:
behavior is global and synchronized across all KPI cards.

---

### 1.2 Change Indicator Color Logic

Change indicator colors are defined based on the business impact of the KPI, not only the direction of the change:

- Positive impact increase → GreenExample: Revenue increase
- Negative impact increase → RedExample: Lost Margin increase
- Stable (no change) → Gray / Black

> Note: The same directional change can be represented with different colors across KPIs. This is an intentional design decision based on business meaning.

---

### 1.3 Tooltip Behavior by KPI Type

The tooltip content shown on hover depends on the type of value displayed in the KPI card.

#### 1.3.1 Monetary KPIs (Currency Values)

On hover, the tooltip shows the following information in order:

1. Comparison reference (Last 1 Day or Last 7 Days)
2. Previous value
3. Change percentage
4. Current value

#### 1.3.2 Percentage KPIs

On hover, the tooltip shows:

metadata.title: Daily Action Board KPI Comparison and Trend Indicators

content:
alue
3. Change percentage
4. Current value

#### 1.3.2 Percentage KPIs

On hover, the tooltip shows:

1. Comparison reference (Last 1 Day or Last 7 Days)
2. Previous value

If the value is stable, only the comparison reference is shown.

#### 1.3.3 Count / Quantity KPIs

On hover, the tooltip shows:

1. Comparison reference (Last 1 Day or Last 7 Days)
2. Previous value

If the value is stable, only the comparison reference is shown.

---

## 2. KPI Trends

### 2.1 Trends Modal Entry Point

The Daily Action Board includes a single Trends button that allows users to view trends for all KPIs together. When this button is clicked, a modal opens.

Within the modal, users can switch between two trend views using a radio button selection:

- Inventory Performance Overview
- Operational Metrics Overview

### 2.2 Inventory Performance Overview

This chart provides a detailed view of all percentage-based and monetary KPIs.

#### Chart Structure

metadata.title: Daily Action Board KPI Comparison and Trend Indicators

content:
This chart provides a detailed view of all percentage-based and monetary KPIs.

#### Chart Structure

- Left Y-axis: Percentage values (%)
- Right Y-axis: Monetary values (USD / currency)
- Visualization:Percentage values → Line chartMonetary values → Bar chart

Both value types are shown together on the same chart for correlation analysis.

#### Interactions & Settings

- A Settings button allows users to customize the chart:Toggle KPI visibility (e.g. Lost Margin on/off)Change visualization type (line or bar)
- KPIs can also have their visibility toggled directly from the legend

#### Time Axis & Tooltip

- X-axis represents time and is planned on a daily basis
- Hovering over a specific week:Highlights that day’s data pointsDisplays values in a tooltip

To view all KPI values together for a given week, the Shared Tooltip option must be enabled in the settings.

### 2.3 Operational Metrics Overview

This chart focuses on count-based metrics and availability-related KPIs.

metadata.title: Daily Action Board KPI Comparison and Trend Indicators

content:
erational Metrics Overview

This chart focuses on count-based metrics and availability-related KPIs.

#### Metrics Included

- Count-based metrics (e.g. WoS)
- Availability Ratio

#### Chart Structure

- Left Y-axis: Count values
- Right Y-axis: Availability Ratio (%)

All interaction patterns from the Inventory Performance Overview apply here as well:

- Legend-based visibility toggling
- Settings-based configuration
- Daily X-axis
- Hover interactions and shared tooltip behavior

---

## Summary

These UI/UX improvements aim to:

- Provide consistent and transparent KPI comparisons
- Reduce ambiguity in KPI interpretation
- Support deeper analysis through interactive trend visualizations
- Align data presentation with business meaning rather than raw directionality

## 1. Overview

The Recommendations module on the Daily Action Board guides users toward high-value actions to reduce revenue loss and capitalize on opportunities.

Figma Prototype
👉 [Daily Action Board Recommendations](https://www.figma.com/proto/yu3k74lGvErQVCHbuk2OT5/Daily-Action-Board?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=1-34737&viewport=361%2C-110%2C0.14&t=XC5QOLLj2rfxYWZL-1&scaling=scale-down&content-scaling=fixed&starting-point-node-id=1%3A34737)

Recommendations are presented under two main accordions:

- Margin Risks and Lost Sales
- Overstock and Inventory Efficiency

For each accordion, up to 3 recommendation cards are displayed by default.

---

## 2. Recommendation List Behavior

ion, up to 3 recommendation cards are displayed by default.

---

## 2. Recommendation List Behavior

- A maximum of 3 recommendation cards are visible initially under each accordion.
- If there are more than 3 recommendations:The card container becomes horizontally scrollable. (Detailed design and interaction behavior will be defined in a follow-up design phase.)Users can scroll to the right to view additional recommendations.

---

## 3. Recommendation Card Structure

Each recommendation card consists of the following elements:

1. TitleA short, action-oriented headline summarizing the recommendation.
2. Priority Action Tag (Optional)Displayed when the recommendation is high priority.
3. DescriptionA concise explanation of the issue.
4. Revenue GainThe estimated financial contribution if the user applies the recommendation.
5. Button – “View Product-Store Pairs”Opens a right-side drawer containing detailed information.

---

## 4. Recommendation Detail – Remi Drawer

a right-side drawer containing detailed information.

---

## 4. Recommendation Detail – Remi Drawer

When the user clicks “View Product-Store Pairs”, a right-side Remi drawer opens.

The drawer consists of three main sections:

---

### 4.1 Recommendation Switch

At the top of the drawer, there are tag components that allows users to switch between recommendations without closing the drawer.

- Users can navigate between recommendations directly.
- The drawer content updates dynamically based on the selected recommendation.
- The currently selected recommendation is shown in an active state.

This ensures seamless comparison and exploration without losing context.

---

### 4.2 Top 10 Product-Store Pairs Table

This section displays the Top 10 product-store pairs related to the selected recommendation.

The data table includes:

- Product Code/Description
- Store Code/Description
- Relevant metrics (e.g., Potential Lost Margin, Initial Target Inventory etc.)

---

### 4.3 Action CTA

levant metrics (e.g., Potential Lost Margin, Initial Target Inventory etc.)

---

### 4.3 Action CTA

At the bottom of the drawer, there is a primary action button that directs the user to take action.

This button:

- Navigates the user to the relevant page where the issue can be resolved.
- Keeps the drawer open during navigation.
- Expects the user to take corrective action (e.g., updating parameters).

---

## 5. Navigation & Interaction Flow

### Return to Daily Action Board

Inside the drawer, there is a Return to Daily Action Board button.

This button:

- Navigates the user back to the Daily Action Board.
- The drawer reopens in its previous state.
- The last viewed recommendation remains selected.

---

## 6. Summary

eopens in its previous state.
- The last viewed recommendation remains selected.

---

## 6. Summary

- Each recommendation combines insight + effect + action.
- Users are not only informed but clearly guided to the next step.
- The drawer structure:Prevents context loss.Enables smooth switching between recommendations.Supports seamless transition to action screens and back.
